field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable this Public Service.

field.label: Name
field.help: Name to identify this Public Service.

field.label: Description
field.help: Description for this Public Service.

field.label: Listen Addresses
field.help: Configure listen addresses for this Public Service, i.e. 127.0.0.1:8080 or www.example.com:443. Use TAB key to complete typing a listen address.
field.hint: Enter address:port here. Finish with TAB.

field.label: Bind option pass-through
field.help:
A list of parameters that will be appended to every Listen Address line.
Example: accept-proxy npn http/1.1

field.label: Type
field.help: Set the running mode or protocol for this Public Service.

field.label: Default Backend Pool
field.help: Set the default Backend Pool to use for this Public Service.

field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable SSL offloading

field.label: Certificates
field.help:
Select certificates to use for SSL offloading. HAProxy's SNI recognition will determine the correct certificate automatically. If no SNI is provided by the client then the first certificate will be presented.
To import additional certificates, go to Certificate Manager.
field.hint: Type certificate name or choose from list.

field.label: Default certificate
field.help:
This certificate will be presented if no SNI is provided by the client or if the client provides an SNI hostname which does not match any certificate.
NOTE: This parameter is optional to enforce a certain sort order for certificates. The certificate itself must still be listed under "Certificates".

field.label: Advanced SSL options
field.help:
Specify additional SSL parameters such as force-sslv3, force-tlsv10, force-tlsv11, force-tlsv12, no-sslv3, no-tlsv10, no-tlsv11, no-tlsv12, no-tls-tickets or customize the list of SSL ciphers.
Example: no-sslv3 ciphers HIGH:!DSS:!aNULL@STRENGTH

field.label: Max. Connections
field.help: Set the maximum number of concurrent connections for this Public Service.

field.label: Client Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum inactivity time on the client side. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Don't log null
field.help: Enable or disable logging of connections with no data.

field.label: Don't log normal
field.help: Enable or disable logging of normal, successful connections.

field.label: Raise Log Level
field.help: Allow HAProxy to automatically raise log level for non-completely successful connections to aid debugging.

field.label: Detailed Logging
field.help: Enable or disable verbose logging. Each log line turns into a much richer format.

field.label: Separate Statistics
field.help: Enable or disable collecting & providing separate statistics for each socket.

field.label: X-Forwarded-For header
field.help: Enable insertion of the X-Forwarded-For header to requests sent to servers.

field.label: Type
field.help: By default HAProxy operates in keep-alive mode with regards to persistent connections. Option "http-tunnel" disables any HTTP processing past the first request and the first response. Option "httpclose" configures HAProxy to work in HTTP tunnel mode and check if a "Connection: close" header is already set in each direction, and will add one if missing. Option "http-server-close" enables HTTP connection-close mode on the server side while keeping the ability to support HTTP keep-alive and pipelining on the client side. With Option "forceclose" HAProxy will actively close the outgoing server channel as soon as the server has finished to respond and release some resources earlier.

field.label: Option pass-through
field.help: These lines will be added to the HAProxy frontend configuration.

field.label: Select Rules
field.help: Choose rules to be included in this Public Service.

field.label: Select Error Messages
field.help: Choose error messages to be included in this Public Service.
